content: keep crawling scarf by lisa martin keep crawling scarf was born out of an idea to put to use all those wonderful color coordinated mini skein sets or beautiful minis that have been collected from travels or yarn crawls i love the idea of knitting a scarf in the round and carefully cutting up the middle to create fringe on either end while this idea is a simple one i also wanted it to have some visual interest i used a mixture of stripes stockinette and garter stitch for ease and interest i hope you enjoy knitting this as much as i did creating it materials finished measurements approximately 12 /30 5 cm by 80 /203cm without fringe after blocking yarn 13 mini skeins of fingering weight yarn 92 helpful notes yards/84 meters equals 20 grams listed as *this pattern is knit in the round and then cut up colors 1-12 with the 13th color used the middle steek to make a scarf and create throughout listed as cc fringe on each end there is no need to weave in sample used destination yarn southwest any ends they will be included in the fringe collection mini skein set plus 1 additional mini *when casting on a large number of stitches you skein can use yarn from both the inside and outside of the ball so there is no guesswork on how long of needles a tail to leave simply cut one yarn end when the us size 4/3 5mm 40 /101 cm circular needle correct amount of stitches have been cast on *gauge is only important to ensure there is notions enough yarn for the project stitch markers 1 different to mark beginning of *you can cast on more stitches to make this round longer but will have to work less row with each sharp scissors color this will also result in a narrower scarf gauge 20 sts x 36 rnds equals 4 /10cm in stockinette stitch after blocking 1 © 2025
